clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Saline Irrigation in the Peritoneal Cavity at Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Saline Irrigation in the Peritoneal Cavity at Cesarean Delivery on Maternal Morbidity and Gastrointestinal System Outcome

lead_sponsor.agency: Istanbul Bakirkoy Maternity and Children Diseases Hospital

clinical_study.source: Istanbul Bakirkoy Maternity and Children Diseases Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypotheised that irrigating the abdominal cavity with saline at the time of cesarean delivery will increase Gastrointestinal System Disfunction without maternal infectious morbidity(especially febril morbidity).

primary_outcome.description: ıntraoperative and postoperative nausea,emesiz and requirement antıemetic drug

arm_group.description: irrigation group:saline irrigation after uterine wall closed control group:no irrigation after uterine wall closed

intervention.description: irrigation in the peritoneal cavity after uterine wall closed at cesarean

study_pop.textblock: all pregnant women between 18 years or older and who requıred cesarean delivery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Elective cesarean delivery
2. Gestational age greater 38 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
1. chorioamnıonıtıs
2. type 1 diabetes mellitus
3. placenta previa and acreata
4. prior severe gastrointestional disease
5. emergency cesarean delivery
